title: program
description: A schema defining academic programs, including faculty, prerequisites, and course requirements.

title.description: title of program as described on the website

program_description.description: how the program is described on the website

faculty.description: the faculty to which the program belongs

credit_requirements.description: contains all of the valid credit configurations that would warrant successful completion of the degree

prerequisites.description: necessary courses to enter the program

course_sections.description: information for the coursework of the program

credits.description: number of credits granted for successful completion of the course

course_code.description: course code assigned to the course

course_section.description: high-level groupings of courses (i.e., required, e/o, or complimentary)

category.description: specifies if the course is required, e/o, or complimentary

course_list.description: list of course summaries in the category

course_range.description: used to describe a large range of courses based on natural language rules

rule.description: the natural language rule used to construct the range

codes.description: list of course code non-numeric prefixes to include

levels.description: the levels of courses to include (e.g., 200, 300)

min_credits.description: minimum number of credits to take from this section

max_credits.description: maximum number of credits from this section that can count toward the degree

credit_configuration.description: a possible combination of required course exclusions that augment the number of credits required to complete the program

credits.description: the number of credits needed for successful completion of the program with these course exemptions

exemptions.description: a list of required courses that are excluded in this version of the program
